questions.question: What is the dominant color observed across the entire visible surface?
Considering the visual texture, what is the apparent surface feel?
Based solely on visual inspection, what material is suggested by the image's appearance?
What is the overall shape of the displayed product, disregarding any edges?
Does the image reveal any noticeable pattern or design on the surface?
What is the overall impression of the surface's apparent sheen or gloss?
Considering the image, what is the apparent thickness of the shown material?
Is there any visible evidence of stitching, seams, or other joining methods?
From the visual inspection, are there visible scratches, blemishes or imperfections?
Judging by the image, is there a discernible grain or fiber direction visible?
What is the perceived level of light reflection on the shown surface?
What is the visual impression of the material's density or compactness?
What is the level of color variation across the visual field?
Based on the image, what is the apparent state of the material: new or used?
From visual clues, is there evidence of any surface treatments or coatings?
